Report.name: Call for Expressions of Interest for the Telus 5G Living Lab

ReportSection.name: Instructions
ReportSection.title: Call for Expressions of Interest for the Telus 5G Living Lab
ReportSection.Static:
Submissions should:
  • Be led by a full-time faculty member of the University of Alberta
  • Be relevant to the focus of the Telus 5G Living lab
  • Have a budget between of at most $100K
  • Must have a commercial potential
  • Indicate a potential customer/receptor to guide the research and innovation

Submission Deadline: September 30, 2022

Purpose:

The purpose of this call is to assemble a set of research proposals that can exploit the UAlberta 5G Living Lab infrastructure to full commercial potential. We are seeking funding from Prairies Can and Alberta Innovates through this new innovation pathway.

The 5G UAlberta Living Lab model will utilize a unique approach to developing and commercializing technologies. The UAlberta Living Lab will use a design thinking approach by involving end-users early in the project. The end-user will help define the problem and design the solution, and will be the ‘first customer’ for the product.

Design thinking is a powerful process of problem solving that begins with understanding unmet customer needs. From that insight emerges a process for innovation that encompasses concept development, applied creativity, prototyping, and experimentation. When design thinking approaches are applied to business, the success rate for solving for the customer improves substantially.

Together with commercialization partners like TELUS, strong technology candidates will be ushered through the UAlberta Living Lab using this approach. Chosen projects will transform Alberta’s digital infrastructure and sustainability. Initial use cases have specific customers in mind - however the development and prototyping of these solutions can be expanded across multiple industry verticals and impact markets, thus creating a sustainable IP and technology future for Alberta.

Process:

The submissions will be reviewed by the CNAS ADRs. All submissions will receive feedback from the committee.

Once the Prairies Can proposal has been funded a new call for complete proposals will be issued.

Applicants are encouraged to talk to David Chang (dc@ualberta.ca).
